hints.content:
To get to point $\green{A}$ from the origin $(0,0)$, we move left to $\green{-4.5}$ and down to $\green{-3}$.


To get to point $\purple{B}$ from the origin  $(0,0)$, we move right $\purple{0}$ and up to $\purple{2}$.


To get to point $\blue{C}$ from the origin  $(0,0)$, we move right to $\blue{4}$ and up to $\blue{1}$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/3ea4b37cd46357439e17cb5926797481e353a507)

Point | Ordered pair
- | - 
$\green{A}$ | $\green{(-4.5,-3)}$
$\purple{B}$| $\purple{(0,2)}$
$\blue{C}$| $\blue{(4,1)}$

To graph $(\blue8, \pink{-5})$,  we move $\blue{\text{right 8}}$ from the origin $(0,0)$, then $\pink{\text{down 5}}$ from there. 


![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/f973358ecf9c939f93e1725c75501efe1c89c920)

To graph $(\blue{3\dfrac12}, \pink{0})$,  we move $\blue{\text{right } \blue{ 3\dfrac12}}$ from the origin $(0,0)$, then $\pink{\text{up 0}}$ from there. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/6411271ae772d24e8c3e49aa8c63f47cf32c2357)

To graph $(\blue{-6}, \pink{-4})$,  we move $\blue{\text{left 6}}$ from the origin $(0,0)$, then $\pink{\text{down 4}}$ from there. 


![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/52aa913ef278b58638575d526e5860e002c9b7b6)

hints.content: The $x$-coordinate is on the horizontal axis.
Values to the right of $-2$ on the number line are greater than $-2$.

The $\redD{\text{red line}}$ shows where $x=-2$. Points to the right of the line have an $x$-coordinate that is greater than $-2$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/e224a64acd3932202e5c284fbe2a534771f25f55)
The points where the $x$-coordinate is greater than $-2$ are point $\greenD{A}$, point $\blueD{C}$, and point $\goldD{D}$.

question.content:
**For which points is the $x$-coordinate greater than $-2$?** 


![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/81b89c100a95686f1fc83f93ef8ad18811345cd5)

[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content: The $x$-coordinate is on the horizontal axis.
Values to the left of $-1$ on the number line are less than $-1$.

The $\redD{\text{red line}}$ shows where $x=-1$. Points to the left of the line have an $x$-coordinate that is less than $-1$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/f6561c2ab29aab82a3357dd34ed90cd5b0c207a7)
The points where the $x$-coordinate is less than $-1$ are point $\purpleD{B}$ and  point $\blueD{C}$.

hints.content: The $x$-coordinate is on the horizontal axis.
Values to the left of $3$ on the number line are less than $3$.

The $\redD{\text{red line}}$ shows where $x=3$. Points to the left of the line have an $x$-coordinate that is less than $3$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/09c5af5dc7b70166283bcc188a1ef7cf1203e525)

hints.content: The $y$-coordinate is on the vertical axis.
Values above $-3$ on the number line are greater than $-3$.

The $\redD{\text{red line}}$ shows where $y=-3$. Points above  the line have a $y$-coordinate that is greater than $-3$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ddaca02e500584173dd1a1ab1d2c9d002af68063)
